alert.note: Alert for Charles City; City of Petersburg; Dinwiddie; Prince George; Surry; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 21 at 3:44PM EDT until July 21 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Charles City County in east central Virginia... The southeastern City of Petersburg in south central Virginia... Prince George County in south central Virginia... Northeastern Sussex County in southeastern Virginia... East central Dinwiddie County in south central Virginia... Western Surry County in southeastern Virginia... * Until 430 PM EDT. * At 343 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Carson, or near Petersburg, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Prince George around 355 PM EDT. Disputanta around 405 PM EDT. Garysville around 410 PM EDT. Waverly and Burrowsville around 420 PM EDT. Cabin Point around 425 PM EDT. Claremont around 430 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Taylors Corner, Carsley, Newville, Birchett Estate, Reams, Spring Grove, Brandon, Jordan Point Country Club, Barham and New Bohemia. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; City of Petersburg; Dinwiddie; Prince George; Surry; Sussex
